alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Pierce (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 4:37AM PST until December 06 at 3:39PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Cowlitz River At Randle affecting Lewis County. Nisqually River Near National affecting Lewis and Pierce Counties. .Rain will continue over the Southern Cascades today but will not be heavy enough to be hydrologically significant. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Nisqually River near National. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8,000.0 cfs, the Nisqually River will flood roads and pasture lands along the upper reaches of the river from Mt Rainier National Park downstream to Alder Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM PST Wednesday the flow was 9,280.0 cfs. - Flood flow is 8,000.0 cfs. - Recent Activity...The maximum river flow in the 24 hours ending at 3:00 AM PST Wednesday was 10,400.0 cfs around 6 PM Tuesday. - Forecast...The river is receding and will fall below flood stage this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at 1245 PM PST.
